intro: Monnina nigrescens, commonly known as blackleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that often turn reddish or purplish in color. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Monnina nigrescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
